entry.title: Standard Integration Packages Plug-and-Play for SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2 and ESM and Utlities
entry.content:
In today's growing CRM demand faster, more agile implementations with minimal overhead. SAP understands this need and has responded with a new generation of standard integration packages for SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2, specially tailored for industries such as Utilities and Enterprise Service Management (ESM). These pre-packaged solutions are designed for plug-and-play integration, eliminating the need for extensive customization and ensuring rapid deployment and value realization.

Why Standard Integration Packages?

Traditionally, integration projects have required significant customization, consulting hours, and effort. This often led to increased costs, longer go-live timelines, and higher maintenance overhead. Standard integration packages reverse this model by offering:

  • Preconfigured scenarios
  • Best practice processes
  • Certified integration content
  • Zero or minimal customization requirements

These benefits help organizations streamline operations, reduce IT complexity, and accelerate time-to-value.

Key Features of the Standard Integration Packages

1. Out-of-the-Box Integration

SAP provides prebuilt connectors and iFlows using SAP Integration Suite (formerly CPI) to integrate SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2 with ESM solutions (e.g., SAP S/4HANA Service) and utility backends (e.g., IS-U, S/4HANA Utilities).

2. Industry-Specific Scenarios

These packages cater specifically to industry needs:

  • Utilities: Handle meter-to-cash processes, service request handling, complaint management, and field service coordination.
  • ESM: Manage enterprise-wide service requests, knowledge bases, approvals, and fulfillment workflows.

3. Certified Integration Content

All integration content is:

  • Published in the SAP API Business Hub
  • Regularly updated and maintained by SAP
  • Based on SAP Best Practices and aligned with standard APIs
Standard Integration PackagesDescription of the Package contains
SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration with SAP CPQ Quote integration between SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and SAP CPQ
SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration for Sales Processes with SAP ERPIntegrate sales processes between SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and SAP ERP.
SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration for Sales Processes with SAP S/4HANAIntegrate sales processes between SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA
SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Integration for Sales Processes with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public EditionIntegrate sales processes between SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 Integration for Master Data with SAP S/4HANAIntegrate master data between SAP Sales and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA
SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 Integration for Master Data with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public EditionIntegrate master data between SAP Sales and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
Qualtrics Integration with SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2Integration flow for integrating Qualtrics and SAP Sales and Service Cloud Version 2
SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 Integration for Master Data with SAP ERPIntegrate master data between SAP Sales and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP ERP
SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2 Integration with SAP SuccessFactors Employee CentralEmployee replication from SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central to SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud Version 2
Sales Cloud Version 2 - Customer Insights Integration with SAP S/4HANAIntegrated transactional data from SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud with Sales Cloud Version 2 - Customer Insights
SAP Service Cloud Version 2 Integration with SAP S/4HANAIntegration of service management processes between SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA (Service Management)
SAP Service Cloud V2 for Utilities Contract Account Integration with SAP S/4HANAThis package integrates Utilities Contract Account transactional data between SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA
SAP Service Cloud V2 for Utilities Master Data Integration with SAP S/4HANAThis package integrates Utilities master data between SAP Service Cloud Version 2 and SAP S/4HANA.
SAP Enterprise Service Management Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud

This integration package enables integration between SAP Enterprise Service Management and SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Resources Available to Customers

Customers can access all relevant materials directly via:

  • üìò SAP API Business Hub: Browse and explore integration packages, iFlows, and APIs
  • üß∞ SAP Best Practices Explorer : Implementation guides, configuration wizards, and sample data
  • üì¶ SAP Integration Suite: Central platform to deploy and manage integrations

Conclusion

SAP‚Äôs standard integration packages for SAP Sales & Service Cloud v2 with ESM and Utilities are a game-changer for businesses looking to simplify and speed up their digital transformation. With true plug-and-play functionality, these packages remove traditional barriers to integration and enable organizations to focus on delivering superior customer and service experiences ‚Äî without the burden of custom development.

entry.title: ‚ÄúBusiness Excellence with SAP‚Äôs New Clean Core Extensibility Levels: Why, What and How‚Äù
entry.content:
1. Introduction:

SAP provides pre-delivered content to run your business. A Clean Core approach means keeping Cloud ERP systems up-to-date, free from unnecessary customizations, and aligned with industry best practices. This gives the benefits of driving innovation-readiness, ensuring seamless future upgrades and reducing technical debt.

1.1 Key guiding principles of a Clean Core

There are five essential guiding principles that contribute to an efficient and sustainable Cloud ERP system:

  1. Processes ‚Äì Streamlining end-to-end (E2E) business workflows for efficiency.
  2. Integration ‚Äì Ensuring seamless communication between extensions and core enterprise solutions.
  3. Extensibility ‚Äì Extending standard software functionality to meet unique organizational needs.
  4. Data ‚Äì Managing configuration, master, and transactional data effectively.
  5. Operations ‚Äì Managing infrastructure, upgrades, system monitoring, and maintenance.

In this article, we will focus on the ‚ÄúExtensibility‚Äù guiding principle.

To support business differentiation while maintaining a Clean Core, organizations can adopt various extensibility models.  A clean core strategy doesn't mean to exclude extensibility entirely, the crucial part is understanding the appropriate way to implement the extensions.  You can create extensions using SAP Build via ‚ÄúSide-by-side‚Äù extensibility (loosely coupled) on BTP (including AI-enhanced pro-code and low-code tools) or through ‚ÄúS/4 HANA On-stack‚Äù extensibility (tightly coupled).

2. WHY New Clean Core Extensibility Levels:

SAP has refined its clean core model, evolving from the former three-tier structure to a more detailed four-level concept (A, B, C, and D). Instead of a simple ‚Äúclean vs. not clean‚Äù classification. These levels show how closely your custom extensions align with clean core principles.

This evolution provides greater clarity for extension decisions and simplifies qualification criteria, giving organizations a more practical way to balance innovation with long-term sustainability. It‚Äôs about making smarter, future-proof extensibility choices while ensuring business differentiation doesn‚Äôt come at the cost of technical debt.

Here‚Äôs what it means in practice:

  1. Smarter, future-proof choices ‚Äì Enable meaningful business differentiation without slowing down with legacy overhead.
  2. Clean, scalable extensions ‚Äì Build on SAP BTP, ABAP Cloud, and SAP Build‚Äîall supported by Joule, SAP‚Äôs AI copilot.
  3. Progress you can measure ‚Äì Monitor and track clean core adoption with tools like the RISE with SAP Methodology Dashboard and ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC). The dashboards will be updated and reflect the new levels.

3. WHAT are the new clean core extensibility Levels:

Before exploring the new clean core extensibility levels are, it is important to understand what an API is‚Äîbecause most of these levels are closely tied to APIs.

  • An API (Application Programming Interface) is essentially a defined set of rules, protocols, and interfaces that allows one software application to communicate with another.
  • In simple terms, an API acts like a bridge. It lets developers access specific functions, data, or services of a system without needing to dive into, or modify, the underlying code.

There are four extensibility levels from the cleanest form of extensions to not clean extensions.

Level A ‚Äì The cleanest form of custom extensions. These are built either directly on-stack with the ABAP Cloud development model or side-by-side on SAP BTP using SAP Build, whether through ABAP Cloud, CAP, or low-code/no-code tools. Represents highest standard in SAP extensibility, offering future-ready solutions with maximum upgrade stability by utilizing released API‚Äôs and extension points.

Level B ‚ÄìExtensions that follow SAP‚Äôs best practices for classic ABAP development and use only officially provided SAP APIs and frameworks. These extensions can be used only if the requirements cannot be fulfilled by set of released APIs (Level A). These include wide range of legacy APIs, user exits, BadIs and established frameworks like SAP GUI and ABAP list viewer grid.

Level C ‚Äì Extensions at Level C involve the use of SAP internal objects that are not classified or intended for customer use. These objects are neither officially released, recommended, nor cloud-ready, and they fall outside SAP‚Äôs formal support scope. However, with the introduction of the new changelog for SAP objects (currently in work and will become later available), customers can proactively analyze and plan for potential upgrade impacts when Level C objects are affected by incompatible changes. For this reason, Level C extensions are considered conditionally clean.

Level D ‚Äì Classified as not clean core. This level includes extensions that don‚Äôt follow SAP‚Äôs guidelines, such as system modifications, reliance on non-recommended SAP objects, or unsupported techniques like implicit enhancements.

Below table explains the differences in each level for comparison.

For detailed guidance on frameworks, technologies and development patterns in the context of clean core extensibility, please refer to SAP Note: 3578329.

4. HOW to find SAP extensibility objects classification by levels:

The ‚ÄúSAP Business Accelerator Hub‚Äù and ‚ÄúCloudification Repository (API Viewer)‚Äù are the central tools to classify objects by clean core level. It shows which objects are:

  • Released APIs (Level A)
  • Classic APIs (Level B)
  • No APIs (Level D)
  • Internal Objects (Level C ‚Äì default when not classified as A, B and D)

The SAP API Business Hub is SAP‚Äôs central catalog of APIs, integration content, and business services. All the APIs are classified as Level A. Remote APIs are for consumption in BTP and local APIs are for consumption in ‚ÄúOn-stack extensibility‚Äù.

The Cloudification Repository Viewer is an interactive tool designed to help developers explore API details for ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Cloud Public‚Äù and ‚ÄúSAP S/4HANA Private Edition‚Äù for on-stack extensions.

Links:

  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition (Doesn‚Äôt include Classic APIs)
  • SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition (Classic API‚Äôs)

In this article, I will be demonstrating the usage of ‚ÄúS/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition‚Äù.

4.1 Extension Level A

The cleanest form of custom extensions. These are built either directly on-stack with the ABAP Cloud development model or side-by-side on SAP BTP using SAP Build, whether through ABAP Cloud, CAP, or low-code/no-code tools. You can find the released API‚Äôs at SAP Business Accelerator Hub. If you are a developer, you can find the released API‚Äôs directly in the IDE (Integrated Development Environment).

 Alternatively, for ‚ÄúSAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition" you can follow the below steps.

Detailed Steps:

1. Go to S/4 HANA Cloud ERP Private  (Doesn‚Äôt include Classic APIs)
2. Click ‚ÄúShow Filter Bar‚Äù

3. Choose ‚ÄúReleased‚Äù under State drop down.

4. You have different options to filter results based on ‚ÄúObject type‚Äù, ‚ÄúSoftware Component‚Äù and ‚ÄúApplication Component‚Äù

5. You can also search for objects (Example of search results for ‚Äúpurchase_order‚Äù)

4.2 Extension Level B ‚Äì Classics APIs:

Extensions that follow SAP‚Äôs best practices for classic ABAP development and use only officially provided SAP APIs and frameworks. These extensions can be used only if the requirements cannot be fulfilled by set of released APIs (Level A). These include wide range of legacy APIs, user exits, BadIs and established frameworks like SAP GUI and ABAP list viewer grid.

Detailed Steps on finding the Classic API‚Äôs:

  1. Go to S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition (Classic API‚Äôs)
  2. Click ‚ÄúShow Filter Bar‚Äù

3. Choose ‚ÄúClassic API‚Äù in the state 

4. You can choose filter criteria as needed

5. You can also search for objects (Example of search results for ‚Äúsales‚Äù)

4.3 Extension Level C ‚Äì Conditionally Clean

Extensions at Level C involve the use of SAP internal objects that are not classified or intended for customer use. These objects are neither officially released, recommended, nor cloud-ready, and they fall outside SAP‚Äôs formal support scope. However, with the introduction of the new changelog for SAP objects (currently in work and will become later available), customers can proactively analyze and plan for potential upgrade impacts when Level C objects are affected by incompatible changes. For this reason, Level C extensions are considered conditionally clean.

  • You can find objects in Level A (Released APIs), Level B (Classical APIs) and Level D (No APIs).

Level C refers to all internal SAP objects that are neither ‚ÄúReleased APIs,‚Äù ‚ÄúClassical APIs,‚Äù nor ‚ÄúAPIs‚Äù at all. Since they are internal objects, no official list exists.

4.4 Extension Level D ‚Äì Not Clean Core

Extensions at level D are classified as not clean core. These includes extensions that doesn‚Äôt follow SAP‚Äôs guidelines, such as system modifications, reliance on non-recommended SAP objects, or unsupported techniques like implicit enhancements.

Detailed Steps on finding objects which are ‚ÄúNot APIs‚Äù classified as ‚ÄúNo APIs‚Äù

  1. Go to S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition (Classic API‚Äôs)
  2. Click ‚ÄúShow Filter Bar

3. Choose ‚ÄúNo API‚Äù in State

4. Results with ‚ÄúNo APIs‚Äù are displayed

5. Successor information is available for some of the objects.

5. Summary:
With this evolved model, SAP is giving organizations a smarter playbook for extension decisions. By aligning with clean core principles on a clear scale (Levels A, B, C and D), businesses can innovate faster, keep their systems future-ready, and reduce technical debt‚Äîwhile still getting the flexibility they need today.

entry.title: Unpacking the new SAP Business Suite
entry.content:
This blog intends to provide a quick explanation of the newly announced SAP Business Suite. The blog contains the latest information as of August 26th 2025.

In February 2025, SAP announced the new SAP Business Suite (https://www.sap.com/events/business-unleashed.html), which was also covered in detail at our prime SAP SAPPHIRE events in Orlando, Madrid, and all the SAP Now events around the world. But you might be wondering what the new SAP Business Suite is.

Simply put, the SAP Business Suite helps our customers drive business innovation to achieve more valuable business outcomes in a constantly changing economy‚Äîby uniting core SAP business applications, data, and Business AI capabilities.

New SAP Business Suite

The SAP Business Suite is not simply a harmonization of release and maintenance schedules for SAP‚Äôs portfolio of solutions. It serves as a transformation engine, helping customers generate rapid cycles of innovation and continuous improvement as a service. This enables organizations to deliver greater business value and achieve improved outcomes through end-to-end processes.

SAP‚Äôs Business Suite applications (like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, SAP SuccessFactors, SAP Concur, etc.) and SAP Business Technology Platform aren‚Äôt just siloed applications; they are integrated along end to end business process, supporting you in every business decision and outcome. This integration ensures that every action taken within these applications generates trusted, business-critical data at its source.

Within the SAP Business Suite, we have also integrated the SAP Business Data Cloud. The SAP Business Data Cloud was also announced in February 2025 . The SAP Business Data Cloud centralizes, harmonizes, and enriches the data produced by the SAP applications and non-SAP applications. So the SAP Business Data Cloud helps us unify data into a single source of truth. Now if this data is contextualized, reliable, and accessible, this data becomes the fuel for advanced AI-driven insights. SAP Business AI, included in the SAP Business Suite, goes beyond basic automation. Through SAP Joule, our AI copilot and the embedded AI capabilities in our applications, employees can orchestrate intelligent agents to collaborate across functions or get enhanced scenarios to increase productivity. This strategy breaks down silos, driving real-time, cross-enterprise optimization. We know our customers are deploying AI in isolated projects, but with our SAP Business Suite strategy, we weave it throughout your organization, unlocking value and resilience at scale.

Let‚Äôs get practical and explain how our customers consume the SAP Business Suite as a service. Next, I will cover the new SAP Business Suite Packages and the journey our customers can follow to implement them.

SAP has created buying center-based packages which provide our customers with defined functional capabilities within our core applications portfolio, data, and Business AI.  The idea is that the package can provide all the necessary capabilities for this buying center and its teams to carry out their responsibilities.

New buying center-based SAP Business Suite Packages

Now, SAP is providing two journeys for our customers so they can consume the SAP Business Suite as a service. The journeys are RISE with SAP and GROW with SAP. Before the February 2025 announcement, RISE with SAP was focused on our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, and GROW with SAP was focused on our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.

Customer Journeys to New SAP Business Suite

Following the introduction of the SAP Business Suite, we have evolved our programs and made several enhancements to the commercial packages supporting these journeys to better serve our customers.

RISE with SAP is a journey focused on existing SAP ERP on-premise customers who are looking to modernize their legacy systems with SAP Business Suite, while GROW with SAP is a journey focused on new SAP ERP customers looking to start fresh with SAP Business Suite.

We also made changes to some names to group our solutions. We now refer to everything relevant to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and its extended capabilities offered in the SAP Business Suite Packages as "SAP Cloud ERP," and everything relevant to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and the extended capabilities offered in the SAP Business Suite Packages as "SAP Cloud ERP Private."

Now, how do we align the SAP Business Suite packages with the customer journeys?  In the figure, you can see that customers have options depending on their SAP journey and buying center. These packages can also be consumed by buying center or brought together for the entire company and buying centers. If you would like to learn more about our packages and what is included, I suggest you visit this link: https://www.sap.com/products/business-suite/pricing.html

Buying center-based packages that enable customer journeys to the new SAP Business Suite

In this blog, I want to focus more on the journeys and packages that have traditionally covered ERP functionalities by highlighting the CIO buying center and the needs of a company-wide system, including other C-suite buying centers who rely on ERP as a comprehensive solution to streamline the introduction of this concept. I won‚Äôt cover other subscriptions like add-ons, data product packages, and AI packages included in the SAP Business Suite, etc., to keep it simple and easy to understand.

Let's begin with Cloud ERP Private. This package is designed to provide customers with tailored-to-fit functionality, a very flexible system in which they maintain the governance of the system while SAP supports operations.

Here, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is included; however, this package encompasses many more capabilities and components compared to traditional ERP (SAP ERP 6.0). The following components are included:

Components included in Cloud ERP Private Package - This content is subject to change. For the most current details, please refer to the link below

The SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages include many different SAP components supporting the CFO and COO buying centers in running their business responsibilities. Here is where you find SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, a system designed to drive business standardization using a fit-to-standard approach, with rapid and agile innovation cycles, operated and governed by SAP.

Each of these packages includes two types of sub-packages: Base and Premium. The idea is to provide customers with flexibility when deciding on the main capabilities for each buying center. Below, I present the capabilities of the two packages:

Components included in SAP Finance Package - This content is subject to change. For the most current details, please refer to the link below

Components included in SAP Supply Chain Package - This content is subject to change. For the most current details, please refer to the link below

As you can see from the packages, the entitlements provided encompass more comprehensive capabilities and components compared to the standalone SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, offering greater business benefits and functional features.

To view the current packages and included latest capabilities, please refer to: https://www.sap.com/products/business-suite/pricing.html

Sample Customer Journeys:

SAP ERP 6.0 customer looking to move to the new SAP Business Suite.

This customer will use the RISE with SAP customer journey to move to the new SAP Business Suite. Here, the customer will have the option to select between various packages depending on their business needs. Considering that this customer runs full capabilities (FI-CO, SD, MM, PP, QM, etc.) in SAP ERP 6.0, below are the choices:

Customer Journey ‚Äì RISE with SAP ‚Äì Final Destination SAP Business Suite

SAP will support the customer with the selection of the right packages by using the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment (SAP DDA). The SAP DDA helps the customer assess functional needs and provides recommendations accordingly. However, it is important to note that the packages are meant to serve two distinct business purposes: Cloud ERP Private‚Äîtailored-to-fit functionality with a highly flexible system where the customer maintains governance while SAP supports operations‚Äîand SAP Finance & SAP Supply Chain, which is designed to drive business standardization using a fit-to-standard approach, featuring rapid and agile innovation cycles, and operated and governed by SAP.  While the SAP DDA assesses functional requirements, the customer must decide on their main strategy: whether to implement and operate their systems with a tailored-to-fit solution or embrace a fit-to-standard model.

SAP Digital Discovery Assessment

Now let's talk a bit more in detail about the journey based on the package selection.

Cloud ERP Private ‚Äì An SAP ERP 6.0 customer needs tailored-to-fit functionality, with a very flexible system in which they maintain governance of the system while SAP supports operations. This customer has selected the Cloud ERP Private Package. Here, they first need to plan their journey to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition from SAP ERP 6.0 using one of the known transition paths: New Implementation, Selective Data Transition, or System Conversion. They will benefit from the use of transformation tools and services included in the package and can also take advantage of the other components included in the package.

With the help of the transformation tools included in the package, in conjunction with the RISE with SAP methodology, we recommend that our customers pursue a clean core strategy, so they can remain technically ready in a cost-effective manner to be agile to consume new SAP innovations.

Customer Journey ‚Äì RISE with SAP ‚Äì Final Destination SAP Business Suite via Cloud ERP Private Package

SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages ‚Äì An SAP ERP 6.0 customer decided on a state-of-the-art system designed to drive business standardization using a fit-to-standard approach, with rapid and agile innovation cycles and operated and governed by SAP. This customer has selected the SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages. Here, they first need to plan their journey to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition from SAP ERP 6.0 using a New Implementation. They will benefit from using SAP Activate, the SAP Signavio Process Navigator, and SAP Cloud ALM to drive their implementation, and can also take advantage of the other components included in the package (either base or premium).  And remember, SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is clean core by definition, using cloud extensibility included in the solution to help our customers differentiate.

Customer Journey ‚Äì RISE with SAP ‚Äì Final Destination SAP Business Suite via SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Packages

To make the most of all the components included in these packages, the SAP Activate Methodology has been enhanced, and there is now a new roadmap available for provisioning SAP Business Suite Packages. I highly recommend using it to take full advantage of the additional components offered.

New SAP Activate for provisioning new SAP Business Suite Packages

New SAP customer looking to move to the new SAP Business Suite.

This customer will use the GROW with SAP customer journey to move to the new SAP Business Suite. Here, the customer will be defaulted to the SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain packages, as our SAP Cloud ERP is the most transformational one.

However, if the new customer might be looking for more tailored-to-fit functionality‚Äîa very flexible system in which they maintain the governance of the system while SAP supports operations‚Äîthe Cloud ERP Package can be offered after the review with the SAP Digital Discovery Assessment.

Customer Journey ‚Äì GROW with SAP ‚Äì Final Destination SAP Business Suite via SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Packages

As indicated before to make the most of all the components included in these SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management packages, the SAP Activate Methodology has been enhanced, and there is now a new roadmap available for provisioning SAP Business Suite Packages.

 

So, what about the other SAP Business Suite packages‚ÄîSAP Strategic Procurement, SAP Core HR, and SAP CX?

These packages were designed based on personas. They provide our customers with defined functional capabilities within our core applications portfolio, data, and Business AI for a specific line of business. However, in combination with the Cloud ERP Private Package or the SAP Finance & SAP Supply Chain Management Package, they can offer even greater business benefits.

So, as in the example above, if an SAP ERP 6.0 customer is also running a legacy SAP ERP HCM system, they can adopt the new package for SAP Core HR to run SAP SuccessFactors and help them manage strategic human resources with solutions like SuccessFactors Employee Central, SuccessFactors Employee Central Payroll, SuccessFactors Time Tracking, etc. SAP SuccessFactors is the next-generation cloud HR product, and this is where we are recommending our customers to move.

If the SAP ERP 6.0 customer is running a legacy SAP SRM 7.0 or any other legacy system to manage strategic sourcing, contract management, or is looking to implement these capabilities, they can choose SAP Strategic Procurement‚Äîan integrated solution bundle for managing the source-to-contract process through sourcing, contract management, supplier lifecycle, and performance management. Included solutions are: SAP Ariba Sourcing, SAP Ariba Contracts, SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance.

If the SAP ERP 6.0 customer is running a legacy SAP CRM 7.0 or any other legacy system to manage comprehensive sales management, service management, or marketing capabilities, then the SAP CX Package (to be delivered in Q3 2025) can help the customer leverage the latest CX portfolio, such as SAP Sales Cloud and SAP Service Cloud.

All Business Suite Packages that are available to existing on-premises SAP ERP 6.0 customers through the RISE with SAP customer journey

The same availability of SAP Business Suite Packages can be provided to a new SAP customer to complement the SAP Finance and SAP Supply Chain Management Packages.

All Business Suite Packages that are available to new SAP customers through the GROW with SAP customer journey

As indicated before, the new SAP Business Suite is not just a harmonization of a release and maintenance schedule of SAP‚Äôs portfolio of solutions. It‚Äôs a transformation engine that helps customers create rapid cycles of innovation end-to-end and continuous improvement as a service. In this regard, SAP is planning to make running the SAP Business Suite easier for customers and is planning to manage the integration of components. Early next year, SAP plans to begin offering SAP Cloud ERP + SAP Core HR managed integration as a service and will continue to introduce more in the future. Of course, these plans are subject to change.

We believe the new SAP Business Suite will help our customers gain more business outcomes by unlocking value and resilience at scale by combining core applications, data and business AI.

I would like to thank my colleagues, Daniel Kesenheimer, Elena Tewari, Matt Emmert & Marcus Venth, for their review and feedback on this blog.

Your insights and opinions are valuable, so please don't hesitate to contribute by commenting on this blog.

entry.title: Unlock Your Business Transformation with the Integrated Toolchain
entry.content:
In early 2025, SAP unveiled the new SAP Business Suite, marking a transformative era in modern enterprise management.
By combining artificial intelligence, data, and applications, SAP Business Suite empowers organizations to unlock innovation, drive operational excellence, and create differentiated business value.

Whether you're an existing SAP ERP customer or new to SAP solutions, transitioning to the SAP Business Suite is a significant step. At SAP, we've had the privilege of guiding many customers through their transformation journeys‚Äîexperience that led to the creation of a structured, repeatable framework: the RISE with SAP Methodology.

This Methodology contains three main elements:

  • The Standardized framework: A structured path based on best practices roadmaps with recommendations, guidelines, and checkpoints for each step of your journey.
  • The Integrated toolchain: Tools to enhance your productivity, accelerate your project timelines, improve quality, and promote seamless, cross-team collaboration.
  • Expert guidance: SAP and qualified partners who get you up and running with a predictable scope and implementation timeline during your entire transformation journey.

In this blog we focus on the integrated toolchain, providing the right integrated tools to support the entire migration process with greater ease and efficiency. And we‚Äôre continuously enhancing these tools‚Äîadding new capabilities and embedding AI to further accelerate and simplify your transformation.

 

Consistent data. Extended by partners. Enabled by AI.

We learned that transformation success depends on more than just a single tool to support individual steps in the journey. Furthermore, it requires:

  • Consistent data throughout the transformation project to align decisions, processes, and outcomes ‚Äì
  • A rich set of integrated tools extended by partners who bring specific expertise and tools to support our customers on their transformation journey
  • AI-enabled intelligence will be omnipresent along the integrated toolchain to support customers, consultants and architects to be more productive during the transformation

All of this combines the Integrated Toolchain

 

 

Together, these principles set the foundation for a successful and effective transformation.

SAPs integrated toolchain is designed to help our customers along the transformation journey with fully connected and integrated tools.

1.     Consistent data flow throughout your journey

The RISE with SAP Methodology provides a clear, structured approach to transformation utilizing the standardized framework. The Integrated Toolchain enables and accelerates this journey from end to end ‚Äî combining tools that support each critical stage with sharing data along the process.

Let‚Äôs have a look on the journey, the individual tasks and how the toolchain will help these processes. In the overview graphics you can see that the different solutions in the Toolchain are not assigned to the different phases, but they support the transformation trough the full project and exchanging data to avoid double entry or inconsistencies. But let‚Äôs start along those phases to go through the transformation project and touch every solution

 

1.1 Discover & onboard

While new customers would directly start with the Digital Discovery Assessment to match their processes and priorities with needed capabilities - existing SAP ERP customers can first start to analyze their current processes based on real data with the help of SAP Signavio. This data is then handed over to SAP LeanIX to analyze and visualize your current architecture including dependencies, identifying risks and outdated systems.  This is the basis for designing the target architecture in the next phase.

As a next step, the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA) helps define your business strategy and design the scope of the future solution by gathering customers‚Äô requirements. Matching these requirements against Business Suite solutions proposes a list of solutions to fulfill all customers‚Äô needs and additionally creates a customer project roadmap based on the customer‚Äôs needs. This is the basis for the customer's individual project roadmap.

1.2 Modernize & run

Based on the data of the Discover phase, SAP Lean IX helps to plan a future-ready architecture aligned with your business goals.

SAP Signavio supports designing and publishing new business process models which are then used by Cloud ALM to support implementations designing, testing and deploying the solutions. Additionally, Cloud ALM executes your roadmap using SAP Activate and best-practice content while tracking progress and managing quality with built-in checkpoints. It monitors and resolves issues proactively with analytics. This includes managing solution configuration, developing and integrating required extensions in adherence to the clean core compatible principals, based on the Business Technology Platform using no-code, low-code or pro-code as well as AI capabilities built in SAP Build. Partner solutions like SAP Test Automation by Tricentis help to design and run automated end-top-end tests to validate changes faster, increase process quality and reduce business risks. The SAP Business transformation center helps to clean and transform your business data of the former system into a AI ready data structures of the new landscape.

To maximize the adoption of new business processes, WalkMe in-app guidance and end-user training can assist to onboard and support users during a successful go-live, helping them use the new system efficiently.

1.3 Continuously innovate

After the successful go live SAP Cloud solution subscriptions include ongoing enhancements delivered through regular updates to enable continuous innovations delivering sustained business value to customers and their end-users.

The tools in the Integrated toolchain will help you shaping this process of continuous innovations:

SAP LeanIX identifies the latest architecture improvements and continuously mirrors the system architecture.

SAP Signavio updates its data to mirror the newest business processes based on the latest enhancements.

SAP Cloud ALM track progress and manage quality with built-in checkpoints and monitor and resolve issues proactively with analytics

WalkMe updates its guidance data to best enable and support users based on the latest enhancements.

SAP Business Technology Platform and SAP Build enable additional process enhancements needed to differentiate your business from the competition - based on continuously enhanced or new extensions, built in a clean core compatible way to maintain and secure an upgradable core.

 

Want to see the integrated toolchain in action ‚Äì just watch our video:

2.     Scale with partners to augment the toolchain

The integrated toolchain is open and extensible to partners who bring specific expertise and tools to support our customers on their transformation journey. Partners can build and integrate their own specialized tools, leveraging deep expertise or industry best practices to complement the core toolset. This openness ensures that every customer transformation project can benefit from proven methodologies, tailored accelerators, and innovative partner solutions‚Äîcreating a flexible ecosystem that adapts to diverse business needs.

3.     Integrated Toolchain enabled by AI

We are adding AI capabilities into our integrated toolchain to boost your transformation efficiency and reduce duration, effort, and cost of transformation significantly.

As an example, SAP Lean IX gets new capabilities based on AI:

  1. Analyze as-is: Leverage the inventory builder to quickly build your inventory based on the AI analysis of unstructured data and the generation of LeanIX fact sheets
  2. Identify improvements: Leverage AI-assisted architecture guidance for continuous recommendations on where and how to optimize your enterprise architecture, with streamlined and actionable insights

On top we are working on the new Transition Guidance - SAP‚Äôs AI enabled application which acts as your pro-active encyclopedia deployed on Cloud ALM to

  • Connect the dots across tools, services and content to further increase usability and efficiency during all three phases (Discover & onboard, Modernize & Run, and Continuous innovations).
  • Provide personalized, system-based recommendations to accelerate fact-based decisions during transformation
  • Add a dialog driven conversational expert guidance based on Joule, giving advice along many advisory categories.

Clear business value

In a nutshell, the SAP Integrated Toolchain is built to deliver clear business value in 4 key dimensions:

30% cost reduction for the transformation project.

35% faster execution of the transformation leading to faster time to value.

70% increased business agility enabling customers to react faster to new market conditions to stay ahead of the competition.

40% Faster continuous innovation to benefit from newest capabilities supporting your business earlier.

 

 

Ready to Take the Next Step?

With RISE with SAP Methodology and the Integrated Toolchain, your transformation becomes a clear, guided journey ‚Äî powered by best practices, intelligent tools, and continuous support.

Learn more: www.sap.com/rise-methodology

entry.title: How to Prepare for SAP S/4 HANA Private Edition Certification (with Sample Questions)
entry.content:
In this blog, I‚Äôll share practical tips to help you to prepare and be able to pass the SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition certification (E_S4CPE_2405). While the post is especially helpful for those aiming to get certified, it also provides useful insights for SAP developers, Basis Admin, SAP Architects, Project Managers, and anyone who works daily in SAP ERP projects or operations.

You often start preparing for a certification and end up confused or lost, what are the right resources, and how deep should you go through different materials and references?

As a Microsoft and SAP Certified , I always tell new learners: preparing for a certification is like learning English as a second language‚Äîyou want to be able to use it effectively in your day-to-day work, not become Shakespeare!
Here, I share the exact resources I use in my day-to-day role as an SAP Architect‚Äîdrawing on over 20 years of hands-on experience in the SAP space. I‚Äôve also included the key materials that can help you confidently prepare for the SAP S/4 HANA Private Edition.

I‚Äôll be updating this post from time to time, since SAP technology and S/4HANA continue to evolve at a fast pace!

Being a successful SAP Solution consultant or SAP Expert requires a deep understanding of both on-premises and hyperscaler technologies, combined with hands-on experience from real customer projects. On top of that, strong expertise in SAP solutions is essential. Earning the SAP S/4 HANA certification is just the beginning of this journey.

This is the second blog of series, I‚Äôm going to share practical insights to help you prepare and succeed to achieve this as a goal.

 Why Get SAP Certified? Real-World Benefits:

  • Being certified earns immediate credibility customers, partners, and hiring managers are more likely to trust your knowledge and decisions.
  • SAP certification improves your chances of landing your desired role.
  • Certified professionals often qualify for higher rates, promotions, and leadership roles in SAP projects.
  • In some cases (e.g., security reviews, migration, SOC 2 documentation), certification adds weight to your approval or sign-off.
  • The annual certification renewal process ensures your knowledge stays current, especially with cloud solutions and SAP's evolving product roadmap.
  • Certification validates your hands-on skills and prepares you to deliver better results in real SAP implementations.
  • Certified professionals are more likely to be chosen for challenging or high-impact projects.
  • Certification gives you recognition within the broader SAP ecosystem.

 Exam Topics and Focus Areas

To pass the certification you‚Äôll need a score of 72% or higher, SAP outlines the following key areas:

  • Introduction to Cloud Computing and SAP Cloud ERP Deployment Options (11% - 20%)
  • Data Migration and Business Process Testing (11% - 20%)
  • Implementing with a Cloud Mindset, Building the Team, and Conducting Fit-to-Standard Workshops (11% - 20%)
  • System Landscapes and Identity Access Management (11% - 20%)
  • Configuration and the SAP Fiori Launchpad (11% - 20%)
  • Extensibility, Integration, and Clean Core (11% - 20%)

 Key Areas of Study

To gain the knowledge required, focus on the following areas:

  • Characteristics of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • RISE with SAP Methodology
  • Customer transition paths to SAP S/4 HANA
  • New Implementation (Greenfield)
  • System Conversion (Brownfield)
  • Selective Data Transition (Bluefield)
  • Key Stockholders and their role & responsibilities
  • System landscapes used to implement SAP S/4HANA
  • S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition release upgrade
  • Cloud ALM Implementation Project setup for S/4 HANA
  • System Preparation Activities for conversion
    • Analyse customer‚Äôs exiting business process (Signavio)
    • Run and review SAP Readiness check report
  • Identity Access Management in S/4 HANA
    • Creating users in S/4 HANA
    • Business Role vs System Admin Role
    • Fiori Launchpad UI
  • SAP Fiori Launchpad
    • Applications and users
    • Content Manager
    • App Manager
  • Fit-to-Standard analysis workshops (mostly for greenfield customers)
  • Business processes configuration, evaluation , improvement
  • Working with SAP Fiori Launchpad
    • My Home, Spaces and Pages Layout
    • Embedded help support and Joule
    • Ange Team and Responsibilities app
    • Situation Handling
  • Extensibility tools for S/4 HANA
    • Clean core tiers
    • Key user In-App Extensibility
    •  Developer In-App Extensibility
    • Side by Side Extensibility with BTP
  • Setting up integration in S/4 HANA
    • Integration Solution Advisory Methodology
    • Setting up integrations with various recourses
    • Integration Monitoring with Cloud ALM
  • Data migration methods to S/4 HANA
  • Testing types and strategy
    • Cloud ALM for test case and test plan
    • Cloud ALM test Automation (Tricentis)

 Note: All the resources listed below are free. You may only need to create a Universal ID to track your progress if the resource is from SAP Learning Hub.

Recommended (Free) Learning Courses:

Exploring SAP Cloud ERP (Learning Course)

Implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

 Important Reference Links:

 From Classic ABAP to Clean Corse

 ABAP Cloud, Wrappers, and ATC for Stable S/4HANA Upgrades

Introducing the RISE with SAP Methodology for SAP Partners and Customers (Learning Course)

Executing Your Cloud ERP Project (Video)

Specifics of transformation to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition (Video)

Clean Core - a holistic concept I Move to Cloud ERP (Learning Course)

Managing Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Learning Course)

Explaining Extensibility Model Best Practices (Learning Course)

Clean core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition (Video)

Extensibility Overview and Guidance (Learning Course)

 Advance Learning and Practice

Implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Learning Course)

SAP S/4HANA Conversion and SAP System Upgrade (Learning course)

System Conversion to SAP S/4HANA (Learning Course)

Clean Core Extensibility (Recent white Paper)

Streamline Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Upgrade (Video)

Learning the Basics of SAP Fiori (Learning Course)

Getting Started with In-App Extensibility in SAP S/4HANA (Learning Course)

Practicing Clean Core Extensibility for SAP S/4HANA Cloud (Learning Course)

Building side-by-side extensions on SAP BTP (learning Course)

Develop extensions for SAP S/4HANA with SAP BTP, ABAP Environment, runtime (Mission)

S/4 HANA Fully-Activated Appliance on Hyperscalers  (30 days trail)

S/4 HANA Cloud Public Edition free (14 days trail)

Before we start the sample questions , let me explain different types of SAP ERP provisioning.

SAP ECC was traditionally deployed in on-premises environments or customer data centres. With the introduction of S/4HANA, cloud provisioning options became available alongside traditional deployments.

Current Types of SAP ERP Deployment Methods

Cloud Editions

  • S/4HANA Cloud, public edition ‚Äì Multi-tenant SaaS, fully managed by SAP.
  • S/4HANA Cloud, private edition ‚Äì Single-tenant, SAP-managed infrastructure.

Note:  Although it runs on cloud infrastructure, S/4HANA Cloud, private edition shares more operational and management characteristics with on-premises deployments (greater customer control, customization, directly accessible via customer's network with no Egress cost, and lifecycle management).

On-Premises with Private Editions

  • S/4HANA Private Edition On-Premises managed by SAP (HEC ‚Äì HANA Enterprise Cloud or ECS ‚Äì Enterprise Cloud Service) ‚Äì SAP hosts and operates the system in hyperscalers  on behalf of the customer.
  • S/4HANA Private Edition On-Premises at hyperscalers ‚Äì Hosted by AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud but managed by the customer or a systems integrator.
  • S/4HANA Private Edition for Government (National security Service -NS2 ) ‚Äì Specialized U.S.  deployment for government and defense, meeting the highest national security certifications in U.S and Canada .
  • S/4HANA On-Premises in customer data center ‚Äì Fully customer-managed.
  • S/4HANA On-Premises via SAP certified partners ‚Äì Deployed using appliances in a customer data center.

Note: RISE with SAP is not a deployment method , it is a bundle offering with one contract.

Legacy Options

  • SAP ECC in customer data center (on-premises) ‚Äì Classic model, customer-managed.
  • SAP ECC at hyperscalers ‚Äì Often a transitional step (Unicode migration, system prep) before moving to S/4HANA in cloud environment.

I've put together 15 sample questions to help you prepare for the exam. These questions are a bit more challenging than the ones you'll typically see on the actual test:

Sample Questions

  1. Which choice is the main used of Launchpad Content Manager? There are 2 correct answers to this question
    1. Manage technical catalogs
    2. Create custom business catalogs
    3. Perform mass changes on business catalogs
    4. Add or remove catalogs content references

  2. In an S/4HANA Private Edition implementation, which type of testing focuses on verifying that the overall system still works as expected after applying changes such as upgrades, patches, or configuration updates?
    1. Unit Test
    2. Business Process Test
    3. User Acceptance Test
    4. Regression Test

  3. During an SAP S/4HANA Private Edition project using the SAP Integration Solution Advisory Methodology (ISA-M), which activity would you expect to complete before selecting integration technologies or designing detailed interfaces?
    1. Defining target integration domains and aligning them with business priorities
    2. Establishing governance guidelines for integration domains and setting decision-making processes
    3. Executing end-to-end interface tests with all involved applications
    4. Configuring middleware connections between S/4HANA and third-party systems

  4. A customer is moving from SAP ECC to the latest release of SAP S/4HANA, which will be hosted and managed by the ECS team. Their requirement is to migrate both master data and full historical transactional data into the new environment. Which transition approach would best meet their needs?
    1. System conversion
    2. Select data transition
    3. Lift & shift
    4. Greenfield

  5. How are SAP Best Practices initially deploy in S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition system?
    1. Through SAP Transport Management
    2. Through SAP Cloud ALM
    3. Through SAP Activate Methodology
    4. Through SAP Solution Builder

  6. A customer running ECC plans to move to SAP S/4HANA Private Edition through a system conversion. They want to follow SAP‚Äôs recommended preparation steps to confirm technical readiness, understand functional impacts, and plan for custom code remediation.
    Which of the following sequences reflects SAP‚Äôs best practice?
    1. Run the SAP Readiness Check ‚Üí Review the Simplification Item List ‚Üí Perform ATC custom code analysis
    2. Perform ATC custom code analysis ‚Üí Run the SAP Readiness Check ‚Üí Review the Simplification Item List
    3. Review the Simplification Item List ‚Üí Run the SAP Readiness Check ‚Üí Perform ATC custom code analysis
    4. Run the SAP Readiness Check ‚Üí Perform ATC custom code analysis ‚Üí Update the Simplification Item List

  7. You are on an SAP S/4HANA Private Edition project where the customer needs to deliver advanced custom business logic that must:
    1.  Reuse internal ABAP application objects (e.g., BAPIs, CDS views) without exposing them via remote APIs first.
    2.   Participate in the same LUW as standard S/4 transactions when required.
    3. Remain upgrade-safe and fully compliant with the ‚Äúclean core‚Äù principle.
    4. Avoid the performance overhead of cross-system remote calls.

           Which approach best meets all of these constraints for a Tier-3 developer extension?

  1. Build the logic in the ABAP environment on SAP BTP (standalone Steampunk) using side-by-side extensions, avoiding any in-stack custom code.
  2. Modify standard ABAP code directly inside S/4HANA to embed the logic within existing processes.
  3. Use SAP Build Apps to deliver the functionality as a low-code/no-code side-by-side extension on SAP BTP.
  4. Develop in the embedded Steampunk ABAP environment inside the S/4HANA system, following in-app extension guidelines and ensuring upgrade safety.

8.  During the Realize phase of an SAP S/4HANA Private Edition project using SAP Activate, the team encounters multiple fit-to-standard gaps that require custom extensions. At the same time, performance issues are found during integration testing, and the customer insists on adding new scope items not originally in the signed backlog.

Which of the following actions are fully aligned with the Activate methodology‚Äôs Realize phase best practices? (Select TWO)

  1. Perform configuration in the Quality system based on the backlog items confirmed in the Explore phase and manage any new scope through formal change control.
  2. Re-open Fit-to-Standard workshops to capture and approve all new requirements before continuing configuration.
  3. Conduct performance tuning and regression testing as part of iterative configuration cycles before the formal User Acceptance Test.
  4. Postpone addressing integration performance issues until after cutover, since Realize focuses on functional build.
  5. Implement all new customer scope immediately to avoid delays, updating the backlog informally.

9. You are in the preparation phase for an SAP S/4HANA Private Edition project and need a platform that provides mission-based guidance, best practices, and ready-to-use service configurations for deploying and extending solutions on SAP BTP. The customer also wants visibility into estimated service costs and technical prerequisites before starting.

        Which SAP platform best meets this need?

  1. SAP Store
  2. SAP Discovery Centre
  3. SAP Business Accelerator Hub
  4. SAP Cloud ALM

10. SAP Cloud ALM You are implementing the latest DMOVE2S4 conversion method (available since SUM 2.0 SP17) for migrating your SAP ECC system from on-premises to hyperscaler cloud. Considering the technical architecture and SUM execution flow, which statements are correct? (Select TWO)

  1. You execute SUM from a newly installed AAS in the target cloud environment, and during the ASCS_ASK phase, SUM automatically detects the remote ASCS instance and offers an "ASCS instance move" dialog to relocate central services to the same target host
  2. You must manually pre-install both AAS and ASCS instances in the target cloud before initiating SUM, ensuring network latency remains below 20ms with minimum 400 MB bandwidth between environments
  3. SUM execution begins from the source PAS while simultaneously creating a shadow AAS instance in the target cloud, with ASCS migration occurring during the EU_CLONE_MNG phase through automated system move protocols
  4. The conversion utilizes standard DMO functionality rather than "DMO with system move," requiring manual post-processing of shared filesystems (/sapmnt/ and /usr/sap/trans) and RFC adjustments after SUM completion

11. In your SAP S/4HANA Private Edition system, you need to manage role maintenance efficiently. Which methods are correct for role management? (Select TWO)

  1. Use transaction PFCG to create roles, assign transactions to menu tree, then generate authorization profiles and perform user master record comparison 
  2. Use transaction SU01 to directly assign authorization profiles to users without generating profiles through role maintenance
  3. Use transaction SU01 to assign users to roles, maintain validity periods, then perform user comparison to activate authorization profiles in user master records
  4. Use Business Role Maintenance Fiori app to create business roles with business catalogs for S/4HANA Private Edition

      12. Which of the following statements correctly describes the Migration Cockpit capabilities and requirements for                     SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition implementations?

  1. Migration Cockpit is a recommended SAP tool that requires separate licensing with dedicated infrastructure setup, exclusively supporting master data migration through manual staging table creation with limited connectivity options
  2. Migration Cockpit is an embedded data migration tool included in S/4HANA licenses that supports both staging tables and direct transfer methods, with value mapping capabilities, simulation features, and comprehensive project management for data migration
  3. Migration Cockpit must be installed and run from the source system with specific add-on requirements, designed exclusively for cloud-to-cloud migrations and cannot support on-premise to private cloud migration scenarios
  4. Migration Cockpit is limited to transactional data migration only and requires mandatory third-party ETL tools for all master data migration scenarios

  13. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, when implementing business workflows that require extensive                    customization capabilities, which of the following statements best describes the workflow development approach         available compared to the Public Edition?

  1. Private Edition only supports standard flexible workflows through Central Business Configuration (CBC) similar to Public Edition, with no access to classical workflow development tools.
  2. Private Edition allows full classical ABAP workflow development using SPRO-IMG transactions and Workbench tools, providing the same customization flexibility as S/4HANA On-Premise systems.
  3. Private Edition requires all custom workflows to be developed exclusively on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) with no on-system development capabilities.
  4. Private Edition uses the same starter system approach as Public Edition, where workflows are pre-configured and cannot be modified beyond standard parameters.

14. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, when implementing SAP Best Practices with multiple country solutions in a greenfield environment, which of the following represents the most critical constraint that must be adhered to during the activation process to avoid configuration conflicts and system errors?

  1. SAP Best Practices can only be activated in client 000 as it serves as the reference client, and all country solutions must be activated sequentially starting with the home country before adding international localizations.
  2. Demo data must be activated for all country solutions simultaneously during the initial activation cycle, as it cannot be transported between development, quality, and production systems via standard transport mechanisms.
  3. Once you activate additional scope items or country solutions, you cannot perform any technical upgrade to the next Feature Package Stack (FPS) or new release, and you must not change the SAP Best Practices configuration for already activated countries/regions.
  4. The group currency can be changed at any time during the activation process, and each country solution can maintain its own local currency independent of the global group currency setting.

15. You are modernizing your ECC system by migrating to S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. What would be the most cost-effective and secure approach to enable external users (who do not exist in your corporate Identity Provider) to access S/4HANA applications?

  1. Configure their external IdP as a Corporate Identity Provider in SAP IAS and use SAP RISE external Load Balancer to access S/4HANA embedded Fiori applications
  2. Configure their external IdP as a Corporate Identity Provider in SAP IAS and use SAP Build Work Zone to provide Fiori access to S/4HANA via federation
  3. Create individual VPN connections for each external user to access the corporate network, then leverage RISE internal Load Balancer to connect to S/4HANA
  4. Create individual user accounts in IAS and configure conditional authentication in the S/4HANA application within IAS to direct users to S/4HANA embedded Fiori

Answers:
1. Answer: b, d
The Launchpad Content Manager is specifically designed to manage business catalogs, not technical catalogs . Its primary functions include:
Creating custom business catalogs
Adding/removing catalog content (references to tiles and target mappings)
Copying catalogs (e.g., copy SAP standard catalog to customize)
Searching for launchpad content
Transporting catalogs [1]

2.Answer: d

Unit Test ‚Äì Verifies that an individual program, function, or configuration element works as expected in isolation.
Business Process Test ‚Äì Checks that complete end-to-end business workflows operate correctly across integrated modules.
User Acceptance Test (UAT) ‚Äì Confirms, by end users, that the system meets business requirements before go-live.
Regression Test ‚Äì Ensures that recent changes (e.g., upgrades, patches) haven‚Äôt broken existing functionality. specifically about re-testing to detect unintended impacts from changes.

3.Answer: b

4.Answer: a
The key points are migrating master data and a full historical data which will be possible only in brownfield or conversion approach.

5.Answer: d
The initial deployment starts by SAP Solution builder in Dev tier then you can use the Transport Management to move that to the higher tier.

6.Answer: a

7.Answer: d
a is tempting because it keeps the core untouched ‚Äî but it can‚Äôt directly call unreleased ABAP objects or share LUW without APIs.
b delivers all technical needs but breaks ‚Äúclean core‚Äù and upgrade safety ‚Äî an instant long-term maintenance risk.
c satisfies low-code/no-code but fails the ‚Äúdeep ABAP integration‚Äù requirement.
d is the only one that ticks all boxes: same LUW, direct ABAP object reuse, upgrade-safe, and compliant with clean core via embedded Steampunk in-app extensions.

8.Answer: a, c
a is correct ‚Äî Realize phase configuration is based on the signed backlog, and scope changes go through governance.
c is correct ‚Äî performance tuning and regression testing are part of iterative cycles in Realize.
b is wrong ‚Äî you don‚Äôt re-open full Fit-to-Standard in Realize, you handle gaps via change requests.
d is wrong ‚Äî delaying performance issue resolution violates Activate‚Äôs iterative build/test principle.
e is wrong ‚Äî skipping governance for new scope breaks methodology discipline.

9.Answer: b
SAP Store ‚Äì to purchase SAP and partner solutions with licensing and pricing options.
SAP Discovery Centre ‚Äì to access guided missions, service setup details, and cost estimations for SAP BTP services.
SAP Business Accelerator Hub ‚Äì to browse and test APIs, integration content, and event definitions.
SAP Cloud ALM ‚Äì to manage the application lifecycle with monitoring and documentation.

10.Answer: a, d
a correctly describes the SUM execution from target AAS and the automatic ASCS move dialog offering [1]
d accurately reflects that DMOVE2S4 uses standard DMO (not DMO with system move) and requires manual post-processing of filesystems and configurations 
b is incorrect because ASCS is NOT pre-installed; it's created during SUM execution
c is incorrect because SUM runs entirely from the target AAS, not from source PAS
This enhanced version tests deeper understanding of the technical architecture, timing of component installations, and post-migration considerations specific to DMOVE2S4 methodology.

11.Answer: a, c
a correctly describes the traditional PFCG approach with proper profile generation and user master record comparison
c accurately reflects using SU01 for user-to-role assignments with validity period management and user comparison process
b is incorrect - profiles should never be directly assigned to user master records without proper generation
d describes S/4HANA Cloud functionality, not Private Edition capabilities

12.Answer: b
A is incorrect: Migration Cockpit is included in S/4HANA licenses and supports comprehensive data migration beyond just manual staging table creation [1]
b is correct: Migration Cockpit is an integrated tool within S/4HANA that provides multiple migration approaches including staging tables and direct transfer methods, with built-in project management, simulation, validation, and execution capabilities for both master and transactional data [2]
c is incorrect: While source system add-ons may be required for specific scenarios (particularly for direct transfer from SAP ERP systems), Migration Cockpit supports various deployment options including Private Edition implementations and on-premise to private cloud migrations 
d is incorrect: Migration Cockpit supports comprehensive migration of both master data and transactional data with built-in capabilities, though third-party ETL tools can optionally be used to populate staging tables [3]

The Migration Cockpit provides integrated capabilities including migration object modeler (LTMOM), project management features, data validation, simulation modes, and flexible migration approaches specifically designed for S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition implementations 

13.Answer: b
a is incorrect because Private Edition does not use CBC (Central Business Configuration) - that's specific to Public Edition [2]
b is correct - Private Edition allows full classical ABAP development and uses SPRO-IMG transactions for configuration, providing extensive customization capabilities similar to On-Premise [1]
c is incorrect because Private Edition supports on-system development, unlike Public Edition which has more restrictions [2]
d is incorrect because Private Edition does not use the starter system approach - that's specific to Public Edition [3]

14.Answer: c
A is incorrect because SAP Best Practices should never be activated in client 000, which is only a reference client [1][2]
c is correct as it reflects the critical boundary conditions that must be followed when activating additional scope items or countries in SAP Best Practices [2]
b is incorrect because demo data activation is optional and can be added later, and demo data cannot be transported via standard mechanisms 
d is incorrect because the group currency cannot be changed once Best Practices activation starts and must be decided upfront [2][3]
Key Learning Points:
SAP Best Practices activation has strict boundary conditions for additional activations [2]
System upgrades and configuration changes to already activated countries can cause activation errors [2]
Group currency decisions are permanent once activation begins [3]
Best Practices should only be used in greenfield implementations [3]

15.Answer: a

To purchase exam attempts if you don‚Äôt have SAP Learning Hub license, you can check the link below:           
https://training.sap.com/content/purchase-certification-attempts

Schedule exam for SAP S/4 HANA Cloud Private Edition certificate

Share with others and Connect with us!

Please leave your comment if you have anything to add!
If you would like to ask questions, please use the community Q&A.
Give us a like and share on social media if you feel it was useful!
You can check my posts and follow me in People SAP @Amin_Omidy 

Thanks and wish you a happy reading !

entry.title: ATP vs Advanced ATP in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private edition 2023
entry.content:
Introduction

Choosing between ATP and Advanced ATP is a crucial decision for organizations seeking future-proof functionality. This guide outlines the key considerations for making the right choice and clarifies the limitations and future roadmap of each platform.

Understanding the Platforms

  • ATP (Advanced To Promise): ATP has served as a robust tool for threat detection and response. However, it is important to note that ATP will not be enhanced with new features going forward. Its existing capabilities will be maintained, but no future innovation.
  • Advanced ATP: Advanced ATP is designed with expanded functionality, incorporating more sophisticated threat analytics and response mechanisms. It benefits from ongoing development and regular introduction of new features to address emerging business challenges.

Key Differences

  • Feature Development: ATP will not receive additional features, while Advanced ATP will continue to evolve with new capabilities.
  • Integration: It is not possible to combine ATP and Advanced ATP functionalities. Each platform operates independently, and use of features from one cannot be merged with the other.

Advanced ATP functionalities

Product Availability Check (PAC)

  • It is possible to configure detailed verification scopes based on specific requirements or quantities.
  • Correlation of Schedule Line quantities in Sales Bill of Material
  • Zero Confirmation or full confirmation at End of Replenishment Lead Time by the configuration

Back Order Processing (BOP)

  • Configuration also enables the extension of prioritization capabilities, allowing users to tailor priority rules according to specific business requirements. By leveraging configurable settings, organizations can dynamically adjust how orders are prioritized during availability checks, ensuring that critical shipments or key customers receive preferential allocation when supply is limited.

Interactive Backorer Processing

  • User can manually change the strategy.

Business Process Scheduling (BPS)

  • Scheduling activities can be incorporated to enable comprehensive planning and management of timelines, allowing users to coordinate and optimize schedules effectively within the system.

Product Allocation Check (PAL)

  • A supply limit function enables users to define maximum available quantities, and configuration values can be conveniently uploaded directly from Excel files for efficient mass updates.

Supply Protection (SUP)

  • It is possible to set minimum supply limits.

Alternative Based Confirmation (ABC)

  • When product shortages occur, the system can automatically switch plants or substitute products based on pre-configured master data settings, ensuring that customer demands are fulfilled as efficiently as possible. This automated substitution functionality enhances flexibility and responsiveness by automatically identifying alternative supply sources or equivalent products, aligning with customer requirements even in the face of inventory constraints.

Dynamic third-party order processing

  • Triggering of third-party order processing (TPOP), where the requirement for ordered goods in a sales order are passed to a vendor (supplier) for direct shipment to the end customer.

ATP Analysis

  • First increment of an improved user experience when reviewing the availability check result in sales order processing:
  • SAP Fiori user experience (UX)
  • Cross-item overview on availability check result
  • Display confirmations including substitutes
  • Navigation to classic delivery proposal screen for non-subitem confirmations to allow proposal adjustments

Interactive ATP

  • With Review Availability Check Results (RACR), users have the ability to manually adjust the confirmed quantities as needed. This feature enables greater control and flexibility in managing order fulfillment, allowing adjustments to be made directly within the system based on changing supply conditions or operational requirements.

Supply creation-Based Confirmation (SBC)

  • In integration scenarios with PP-DS, support is provided for both Characteristics-Dependent Planning (CDP) and Support Block Planning within PP/DS, enabling sophisticated planning capabilities based on product characteristics and optimized scheduling through block planning methods.

Release for delivery (RefDy)

  • It is possible to manually adjust the allocated confirmed quantity during the creation of delivery documents, providing additional flexibility in the shipping process.

Advanced ATP Online help:

ATP Functionalities

Product Availability Check

  • Basic Product Availability check
  • Manually selection product
  • Manually plant selection changing
  • Simple transportation and shipment scheduling based on days (and hours)

Back Order Processing

  • Basic Backorder processing.
  • The available prioritization options are quite limited, restricted mainly to dates and shipping priority, and cannot be extended beyond these parameters.

ATP Online Help:

How to Choose

  • If your organization requires only the current feature set and stability, ATP may be sufficient. However, be aware that there will be no further feature enhancements.
  • If your organization needs advanced features and the flexibility to adapt to new threats, Advanced ATP is the recommended choice. Its ongoing development ensures access to the latest tools.
  • Consider your long-term strategy. For organizations aiming for future scalability and innovation, Advanced ATP will be more appropriate.
  • Advanced ATP requires an additional license beyond S/4HANA. Please contact your our sales guys about the detail.

Limitations

  • You cannot use ATP and Advanced ATP functionalities together. Selection of one platform means you rely exclusively on its feature set.
  • Migrating from ATP to Advanced ATP may require reconfiguration, so plan the transition carefully if you anticipate future needs for newer features.

Conclusion

When deciding between ATP and Advanced ATP, assess your organization‚Äôs future goals. If long-term growth and adaptability to new threats are priorities, Advanced ATP is the optimal selection. For static requirements with no need for new functionalities, ATP remains a viable, though limited, option. The inability to combine both platforms‚Äô features underscores the importance of a clear, strategic choice.

 

Brought to you by the SAP S/4HANA Customer Care and RIG

entry.title: Joule provisioning with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using Cloud Integration Automation service
entry.content:
We are happy to announce that Joule integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is now available in Cloud Integration Automation service as one of the integration scenarios.

Joule, being the next generation AI copilot from SAP, it is important for SAP to make Joule provisioning and setup easy and automated for its customers. Joule is available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition within RISE with SAP. The existing manual integration process is complex, time consuming and the whole integration process can take weeks, but thanks to the automation capabilities provided by the Cloud Integration Automation service, the Joule integration set up is now much simpler and faster, reduced to just days.

By leveraging the Cloud Integration Automation service (offered as a service within BTP) at no additional cost, setting up Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition is now considerably faster, simpler, and more reliable. This service allows for the automation of number of integration steps, significantly reducing the overall integration effort for SAP customers.

Customer can leverage ready-to-use guided workflows, automations, and role-specific execution to simplify and accelerate the entire Joule integration.

Involved Components

The different component involved are 

  • SAP BTP
  • SAP Cloud Connector
  • SAP S/4HANA PCE
  • SAP Cloud Identity Services

Though the Joule integration process is complex, the Cloud Integration Automation service is ideally positioned to connect Joule with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition for these reasons:

  • Cloud Integration Automation service being an AI enabled task orchestration tool.
  • Out of the box standardized guided workflows and role-based execution.
  • Integrated parameter management
  • Hybrid approach, where in it can automate the steps and provide a documentation which cannot be automated.
  • Cloud Integration Automation service comes with no additional cost and the service is available in SAP BTP.
  • Cloud Integration Automation service can provide the system landscape information hence bringing greater visibility of the entire customer landscape

The Joule integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition can be broadly classified into following:

1) SAP BTP Configuration

To conclude, Cloud Integration Automation service with its automation and workflow capabilities not only made the Joule integration easy and automated but also helps in accelerating the Joule adoption in the private cloud space.
